gurmukhi: ਕੰਚਨ ਅਸੁਧ ਜੈਸੇ ਭ੍ਰਮਤ ਕੁਠਾਰੀ ਬਿਖੈ ਸੁਧ ਭੲੇ ਭ੍ਰਮਤ ਨ ਪਾਵਕ ਪ੍ਰਗਾਸ ਹੈ
transliteration: Kanchan Asudh Jaisay Bhramat Koutthaaree Bikhai , Sudh Bhaay Bhramat N Paavak Pragaas Hai ?
translation: As impure gold when heated in a crucible, keep on moving here and there but when purified becomes stable and glitters like fire.

gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਕਰ ਕੰਕਨ ਅਨੇਕ ਮੈ ਪ੍ਰਗਟ ਧੁਨਿ ੲੇਕੈ ੲੇਕ ਟੇਕ ਪੁਨਿ ਧੁਨਿ ਕੋ ਬਿਨਾਸ ਹੈ
transliteration: Jaisay Kar Kankan Anayk Mai Pragat Dhouni , Aykai Ayk Tayk Pouni Dhouni Ko Binaas Hai ?
translation: If many bangles are worn in one arm, they keep making noise by striking with each other but when melted and made into one become quiet and noiseless.

gurmukhi: ਖੁਧਿਅਾ ਕੈ ਬਾਲਕ ਬਿਲਲਾਤ ਅਕੁਲਾਤ ਅਤ ਅਸਥਨ ਪਾਨ ਕਰਿ ਸਹਜਿ ਨਿਵਾਸ ਹੈ
transliteration: Khudhiaa Kai Baalak Bilalaat Akulaat Ata , Asadan Paan Kari Sahaji Nivaas Hai ?
translation: Just as a child cries when hungry but becomes quiet and peaceful after suckling milk from his mother's breasts.

gurmukhi: ਤੈਸੇ ਮਾੲਿਅਾ ਭ੍ਰਮਤ ਭ੍ਰਮਤ ਚਤੁਰ ਕੁੰਟ ਧਾਵੈ ਗੁਰ ੳੁਪਦੇਸ ਨਿਹਚਲ ਗਿਿ੍ਹ ਪਦ ਬਾਸ ਹੈ ||੩੪੯||
transliteration: Taisay Maaiaa Bhramat Bhramat Chatur Kount Dhaavai , Gur Oupadays Nihachal Grihi Pad Baas Hai ?349?
translation: Similarly a human mind engulfed in worldly attachments and love keeps on wandering all over. But by the sermons of the True Guru, he becomes stable and calm. (349)
